lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Said David Gluskin, vice-president of Nesbitt Thomson Bongard Inc, "When interest rates finally seem to have stopped going down, there is going to be a flood of people trying to lock in the long end and not everyone will be able to get in the door."

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: The Bank of Canada, Ottawa's fiscal agent in the marketplace, revealed this week that sharply reduced borrowing needs has allowed the shift toward shorter bond terms and heavier emphasis on the weekly treasury bill auction, issued in terms of up to one year.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Although the amount of money saved from moving away from the long bonds was not disclosed, bond experts believe it was considerable because of the much lower interest premiums paid on short term debt.

lst.name: sentence
